intent: Update documentation to highlight smart merge conflict resolution feature
reasoning_trace:
Added comprehensive documentation of the append-only merge strategy feature that was just implemented.

README.md improvements:
- New 'Smart Merge Conflict Resolution' section right after 'Why Lore?' comparison table
- Visual example showing the contrast: Branch A + Branch B â†’ Both entries preserved
- Highlights key benefits with checkmarks: preserves both, zero manual conflict resolution, shows decision history
- Links to detailed MERGE_STRATEGY.md documentation for users who want to learn more
- Practical example showing how 'lore explain --all' reveals reasoning from both branches

docs/index.html improvements:
- Added full featured section between 'Why Lore?' table and 'Installation'
- Side-by-side comparison cards showing 'Without Lore' (lose context) vs 'With Lore' (preserve all)
- Three key feature cards using FontAwesome icons:
  * fa-code-branch: Zero Conflicts (no manual resolution)
  * fa-layer-group: Preserve All (both branches kept)
  * fa-history: Complete History (view with lore explain --all)
- Example code block showing actual output after merge
- Real-world scenario showing different agents on different branches
- Uses site theme colors (primary pink for highlights, coffee-bean for backgrounds)
- Responsive grid layout (mobile/tablet/desktop compatible)

Why this placement:
- Right after 'Why Lore?' comparison: Immediately shows unique competitive advantage
- Before 'Installation': Users understand value proposition before setting up
- Prominent feature section: Demonstrates problem-solving capability

Target audience:
- Teams working on parallel features/branches (conflicts are real)
- Multi-agent development scenarios
- Organizations wanting to preserve decision history across all teams
- Anyone frustrated with merge conflicts losing context

rejected_alternatives.name: Putting merge strategy feature at the end (less discoverable)
Only documenting in code comments (invisible to web visitors)
